channel.title: Picture animation help
channel.description: I was wondering if anyone new how to make animated pictures, or how to make a single picture scroll through a number of pictures?

item.title: Picture animation help
item.dc:creator: @bullzeye95 bullzeye
item.description:
@bullzeye95 wrote:

I have one. It's called KoolMoves. Download it http://www.download.com/KoolMoves/3000-6676_4-10528861.html <there.

Id doesn't word that good, but it will get the job done.

Read full topic

item.title: Picture animation help
item.dc:creator: @Omfgurweird Omfgurweird
item.description:
@Omfgurweird wrote:

bumfluff120:

[quote author=Omfgurweird link=topic=761.msg17042#msg17042 date=1145749775]
Ok, so what you need to do is...Have your picture open in photoshop CS2, then click on the "edit in image ready" button. Then it will load up your image in image ready derr, now click on the window tab, and choose animation. Then an animation box will pop up and you can do all the animating you want to the picture. If you want it to go threw a bunch of pics then, copy paste them into 1 sig (dont worry it will make a new layer for every one :)) Now all you have to do is hide the certain sigs you dont want to appear at the moment. Any questions add me on msn.

lol nice thought but i have neither photoshop nor image ready lol and if i did my comp would probably crash i have so much junk on it.[/quote]

Hmm, well that could be a problem, I don't know how you can make it without having either of those programs. You can send me it and i can do it for you if you would like, I'll keep looking for a program that could help you out though

Read full topic

item.title: Picture animation help
item.dc:creator: @Omfgurweird Omfgurweird
item.description:
@Omfgurweird wrote:

Ok, so what you need to do is...Have your picture open in photoshop CS2, then click on the "edit in image ready" button. Then it will load up your image in image ready derr, now click on the window tab, and choose animation. Then an animation box will pop up and you can do all the animating you want to the picture. If you want it to go threw a bunch of pics then, copy paste them into 1 sig (dont worry it will make a new layer for every one :)) Now all you have to do is hide the certain sigs you dont want to appear at the moment. Any questions add me on msn.

Read full topic
